utterance.content: Hello, I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. My apologies that this episode is coming late. My heart goes out to the members of the African-American community, who, like me, have been kept down by The Man. Now, Fun with Flags is not just for the flag aficionado, it’s also for the flag novice, so, to help me with that, please welcome my friend, neighbour, and flag virgin, yeah, not a real virgin. utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, Penny, I understand you would like to learn more about flags.

utterance.content: I just think it might look more natural if you talked to me instead of the camera, you know, like, like a real conversation. It’s something we work on in my acting class.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. A few people in the comments section have said that my delivery is robotic. Perhaps that isn’t the compliment it sounds like.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, let’s try it again, and maybe, this time, you could work on your body language a bit. You know, when you’re all hunched like that, you’re shutting the audience out, but when you’re relaxed and open, you’re inviting them in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If our friend, the flag, has taught me anything, it’s to go where the wind takes you. As long as you remain firmly attached to a rigid pole. And, action. So, Penny, what sort of flag questions keep you awake at night?

utterance.content: Um, well, I’m from Nebraska. So what can you tell me about the state flag?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gosh, Penny, what’d you have for breakfast? A big glass of good question juice? The Nebraska state flag is simply the state seal on a field of blue. Spread your legs, invite them in.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m telling you, something’s wrong. I can always feel it when Raj is in trouble.

utterance.content: Geez, how close were you guys before we got married?

utterance.content: Oh, just because I’ve stopped going to work and answering my phone you think something bad happened? Maybe something good happened.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, you poor baby.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, for God’s sake, just come to the play.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.content: You know, I haven’t seen Raj in several days. Is he no longer a part of our social group? And if so, should we be interviewing for a replacement? Perhaps, this time, we go Latin.
